definition: again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items

sentences.english: It is usually added that understanding must not go too far.
sentences.chinese: 再則，也常有人說，理智不可太趨於極端。

sentences.english: Another reason that I think men cheat is because they just don't feel desired anymore.
sentences.chinese: 再則男人欺騙女人是因爲他們不再有慾望。

sentences.english: Again, the lesson is that most software is done as extensions to existing systems.
sentences.chinese: 再則，大多數軟件已經作爲現有系統的延伸而存在了。

sentences.english: Moreover, there are signs that demand is rising outside of vehicle sales.
sentences.chinese: 再則，有跡象顯示，汽車市場之外的需求也在回升。
